TI THERMODYNAMIC CONSIDERATIONS FOR ELIMINATING P AND SI FROM MOLTEN COPPER
   BY NA2CO3-BASED SLAG
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE THERMODYNAMICS; ACTIVITY; DISTRIBUTION RATIO; SODIUM CARBONATE SLAG;
   COPPER; PHOSPHORUS; SILICON; SIO2; PO2.5; NA3PO4
ID DISTRIBUTION RATIO; BETA-ALUMINA; MELTS; CO2; SB; SOLUBILITIES;
   ELECTROLYTE; NA2O
AB Thermodynamic properties of NaO0.5-CO2-XO(upsilon/2) slag (X: P or Si, upsilon: valence of X) have been investigated by conducting the following measurements:
   (1) Solubility measurements of Na3PO4 (s) into sodium carbonate melts at 1423 to 1523 g under various partial pressures of CO2 and oxygen.
   (2) Activity measurements of NaO0.5 under various partial pressures of CO2.
   (3) Solubility measurements of CO2 in the slags.
   Based on the results, the equilibrium distribution ratios of P and Si between the slags and the molten copper have been estimated as a function of partial pressures of CO2 and oxygen and the slag composition at 1523 K.

TI DYNAMICAL SUPERFLUID DENSITY IN VORTEX STATE OF TYPE-II SUPERCONDUCTORS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE VORTEX STATE; SUPERFLUID DENSITY; VORTEX LATTICE; VORTEX LIQUID; ELASTIC
   THEORY; VORTEX ENTANGLEMENT; VORTEX CUTTING; LINEAR RESPONSE THEORY
ID HIGH-TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS; LONGITUDINAL CRITICAL CURRENT; HIGH-TC
   SUPERCONDUCTORS; MAGNETIC-FIELD; RESISTIVE TRANSITION; ORDER PARAMETER;
   ELASTIC ENERGY; FLUX LIQUIDS; MIXED-STATE; FLUCTUATIONS
AB The electromagnetic linear response both in the lattice state and liquid state of vortices in type-II superconductors are studied based on the dynamical superfluid density. The calculations are carried out paying special attention to the difference of the internal and the external vector potential. By use of the obtained dynamical superfluid density the static superfluid density, the electric conductivity and the magnetic permeability are studied. A significant difference in responses between the two states is found especially in the Lorentz force free configuration, namely when the supercurrent flows in the direction parallel to the applied magnetic field; the vortex lattice state is superconducting in this direction while the liquid state is not becaue of the vortex entanglement and cutting effects. The magnetic susceptibility, especially in lattice state, has been examined in detail.

TI THERMODYNAMIC PROPERTIES OF NAO0.5-CO2-FEO1.5 SLAG
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE THERMODYNAMICS; ACTIVITY; SODIUM CARBONATE SLAG; NAO0.5-CO2-FEO1.5 SLAG;
   NAFEO2; IRON; COPPER; ELECTROMOTIVE FORCE METHOD
ID DISTRIBUTION RATIO; MOLTEN COPPER; LIQUID COPPER; SB; EQUILIBRIA; MELTS
AB Thermodynamic properties of NaO0.5-CO2-FeO1.5 slag have been investigated for the application of sodium carbonate slag to the elimination of Fe from molten copper.  The activities of NaO0.5 and Na(CO3)0.5 were measured by the EMF method, using beta''-alumina as a solid electrolyte for various partial pressures of CO2 at 1423 to 1523 K.  There is a stable solid compound NaFeO2 in this system, and the solubility measurement of this compound into sodium carbonate melt at 1523 K revealed that the solubility is highly limited and controlled by the partial pressure of CO2.  The dissolution reaction seems to proceed according to the following reaction and Fe exists as FeO3(3-) anion in the sodium carboante-based melt.
   2Na(CO3)0.5(l) + NaFeO2(s) = Na3FeO3(l) + CO2(g).
   The standard free energy change for the following reaction was determined as,
   NaO0.5(l) + FeO1.5(s) = NaFeO2(s)
   DELTAG-degrees/J = - 115000 - 10.33TIn T + 98.32T(1283 approximately 1423 K)
   by the EMF method.  The activity of FeO1.5 in the NaFeO2(s)-saturated slag could be calculated by the above equilibrium relation from the activity of NaO0.5.  The activity of FeO1.5 in the homogeneous liquid region of the slag was also evaluated by the distribution equilibrium measurements.  The activity coefficient of FeO1.5 in the homogeneous liquid region has a constant value for a constant CO2 partial pressure, independent of the concentration.
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,SCH ENGN,DEPT MAT SCI & ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

TI THERMODYNAMIC CONSIDERATIONS FOR ELIMINATION OF TE AND SE FROM MOLTEN
   COPPER BY USING NA2CO3 SLAG
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE THERMODYNAMICS; ACTIVITY; SODIUM CARBONATE SLAG; COPPER; TELLURIUM;
   SELENIUM; ELECTROMOTIVE FORCE METHOD; NAO0.5-CO2-TEO2 SLAG;
   NAO0.5-CO2-SEO2 SLAG; DISTRIBUTION RATIO
ID DISTRIBUTION RATIO; CO2; SB; MELTS
AB In order to estimate the distribution ratios of Te and Se between sodium carbonate-based slag and molten copper, the following measurements have been conducted on the thermodynamic properties of the slags containing Te- or Seoxide at 1423 to 1523 K.
   (1) Electrochemical measurements of activity of NaO0.5 in NaO0.5-CO2-XO(2) slag (X: Te or Se) under various partial pressures of CO2 over the composition range of 1 > N greater than or equal to 0.667 {N=n(Na)/(n(Na)+n(X)), n: the number of moles} by using beta''-alumina as a solid electrolyte.
   (2) Distribution equilibrium measurements of X between the slag and molten copper, and
   (3) Solubility measurements of CO2 in the slags.
   Finally, based on the results, the equilibrium distribution ratios of these elements between the slags and molten copper have been estimated as a function of partial pressures of CO2 and oxygen and the slag composition at the temperatures of 1423 K and 1523 K. Higher distribution ratios for both elements are achieved under conditions of higher partial pressure of oxygen and lower partial pressure of CO2.
   Distribution experiments were also conducted for the slag of N congruent to 1 in order to evaluate the effect of partial pressure of oxygen on the distribution ratios. The distribution ratios of Te and Se have two different dependences on the oxygen partial pressure. Under the relatively low oxygen partial pressure, the distribution ratios of both elements decrease with increasing oxygen partial pressure while, under the relatively high oxygen partial pressure the distribution ratios increase with increasing oxygen partial pressure. In both areas, higher distribution ratios are achieved under the condition of lower partial pressure of CO2.
RP ALVEAR, GR (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,SCH ENGN,DEPT MAT SCI & ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.
CR Barin I., 1989, THERMOCHEMICAL DATA
   FUJISAWA T, 1992, 4TH P INT C MOLT SLA, P602

TI COLLAPSE OF QUANTIZED CONDUCTANCE IN A DIRTY TOMONAGA-LUTTINGER LIQUID
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID FERMI GAS; TRANSPORT; RESISTANCE; MODEL; SYSTEM
AB The way the quantized value of conductance in a quantum wire disappears is predicted as a function of temperature and length of the wire by taking account of both impurity scattering and mutual Coulomb interactions, i.e., in the case of a dirty Tomonaga-Luttinger liquid. It is shown that quantization of conductance is realized for short wires, while for longer wires the effect of impurity scattering is important and a deviation from the quantized value becomes apparent especially at low temperatures. In this case the conductance shows a distinctive temperature dependence.
C1 UNIV TOKYO, DEPT PHYS, BUNKYO KU, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.
RP OGATA, M (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, COLL ARTS & SCI, INST PHYS, MEGURO KU, TOKYO 153, JAPAN.

TI AXIAL SUBSTITUTION-REACTION OF SUBSTITUTED PYRIDINE ON
   CHLORO(5,10,15,20-TETRAPHENYLPORPHINATO)CHROMIUM(III) IN TOLUENE WITH
   SPECIAL REFERENCE TO THE SUBSTITUENT EFFECT
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID ACID SIDE-CHAINS; AQUEOUS-SOLUTION; PORPHYRIN COMPLEXES;
   METALLOPORPHYRIN REACTIONS; DISSOCIATIVE MECHANISM; COBALT(III)
   PORPHYRIN; IRON(III) PORPHYRINS; N-METHYLIMIDAZOLE; NITROGENOUS BASES;
   RATE ENHANCEMENTS
AB Equilibria and kinetics for the axial substitution reaction of pyridine and substituted pyridines (L) co-ordinated to chloro(5,10,15,20-tetraphenylporphinato)chromium(III) [Cr(tpp)(Cl)] by 1-methylimidazole as an entering ligand in toluene have been studied spectrophotometrically. Equilibrium constants, rate constants, and activation parameters for the substitution of L from the six-coordinated [Cr(tpp)(Cl)(L)] complex have been obtained. It has been demonstrated that equilibrium constants of the substitution reaction depend on the basicity of the axial ligands and that a good linear relationship between the activation parameters and the basicity of L is in accord with the reaction mechanism with a limiting dissociative activation mode.
C1 NAGOYA UNIV,FAC SCI,ANALYT CHEM LAB,CHIKUSA KU,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.
   AICHI UNIV EDUC,FAC EDUC,DEPT CHEM,KARIYA 448,JAPAN.

AU TATARA, G
   FUKUYAMA, H
AF TATARA, G
   FUKUYAMA, H
TI MACROSCOPIC QUANTUM TUNNELING OF A DOMAIN-WALL IN A FERROMAGNETIC METAL
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE MACROSCOPIC QUANTUM TUNNELING; METALLIC FERROMAGNET; DOMAIN WALL;
   DISSIPATION
ID CHEMICALLY DISORDERED MAGNET; MAGNETIZATION REVERSAL; DISSIPATION;
   PARTICLES; SYSTEMS; SPINS; INTERFERENCE; ANTIFERROMAGNETS; NUCLEATION;
   COHERENCE
AB The macroscopic quantum tunneling of a planar domain wall in a ferromagnetic metal is studied based on the Hubbard model. An effective action of the magnetization for the slowly varying case is obtained to be the same as that of a ferromagnetic Heisenberg model with a term non-local in time that describes the dissipation due to the itinerant electron. The crucial difference from the case of an insulator is the presence of the Ohmic dissipation even at zero temperature due to the gapless Stoner excitation. The dissipative effect is calculated by use of the instanton method, and is found to be very large for a thin domain wall with thickness of a few times the lattice spacing, but is negligible for a thick domain wall. Dissipation due to eddy current is shown to be irrelevant for a wall of mesoscopic size. The results are discussed in the light of recent experiments on ferromagnets with strong anisotropy.
RP TATARA, G (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RI Tatara, Gen/I-8676-2012
CR AWAKA K, 1993, J PHYS SOC JPN, V62, P1939, DOI 10.1143/JPSJ.62.1939

AU TANAMOTO, T

   FUKUYAMA, H
AF TANAMOTO, T
   KOHNO, H
   FUKUYAMA, H
TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF EXTENDED T-J MODEL .2. DYNAMICAL PROPERTIES
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE HIGH-TC CUPRATES; SPIN FLUCTUATION; SPIN GAP; NMR; SPIN-LATTICE
   RELAXATION RATE; SPIN-SPIN RELAXATION RATE; INELASTIC NEUTRON
   SCATTERING; T-J MODEL; SLAVE BOSON; RVB; FERMI SURFACE
ID VALENCE-BOND STATE; MEAN FIELD-THEORY; ANGLE-RESOLVED PHOTOEMISSION;
   SPIN DYNAMICS; NEUTRON-SCATTERING; FERMI-SURFACE; NUCLEAR-RELAXATION;
   ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; CU-OXIDES; SUPERCONDUCTING PROPERTIES
AB The dynamical spin susceptibility, chi(q, omega), of the extended t-J model, which reproduces Fermi surfaces of LSCO and YBCO type of high-T(c) cuprates, has been evaluated in the slave-boson mean field approximation based on the uniform (u-) and the d-wave singlet (s-) RVB states. The calculated results show reasonable agreement with neutron scattering data for the incommensurate structure in LSCO. For the commensurate structure in 90 K YBCO, the omega-dependence shows general agreement, but the location of the strongest peak at low temperatures does not. The temperature (T) dependences of the rates, T1(-1) and T(G)-1, and the shift of NMR are consistent with experimental data in the high-doping region, while they are not in the low-doping (but superconducting) region. We propose that the sharp drop in (T1T)-1 above T(c) in the low-doping region may be due to singlet formation.

TI THEORETICAL-STUDY OF FRICTION - ONE-DIMENSIONAL CLEAN SURFACES
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID CHARGE-DENSITY-WAVES; ATOMIC-SCALE FRICTION; LEE-RICE MODEL; DYNAMIC
   PROPERTIES; CONDUCTIVITY; STATE
AB Another method has been proposed to evaluate the frictional force in the stationary state. This method is applied to the one-dimensional model of clean surfaces. The kinetic frictional force is seen to depend on velocity in general, but the dependence becomes weaker as the maximum static frictional force increases and in the limiting case the kinetic friction becomes only weakly dependent on velocity as described by one of the laws of friction. It is also shown that there is a phase transition between a state with vanishing maximum static frictional force and a state with finite static frictional force. The role of randomness at the interface and the relation to the impurity pinning of the sliding charge-density wave are discussed.
C1 OSAKA UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOYONAKA,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.
RP MATSUKAWA, H (reprint author), NARA WOMENS UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,NARA 630,JAPAN.

TI THERMODYNAMICS OF NAO0.5-CO2-SNO2 SLAG AND ESTIMATION OF DISTRIBUTION
   RATIO OF SN BETWEEN THE SLAG AND MOLTEN COPPER
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE THERMODYNAMICS; ACTIVITY; SODIUM CARBONATE SLAG; COPPER; TIN;
   NAO0.5-CO2-SNO2 SLAG; ELECTROMOTIVE FORCE METHOD; NA2SNO3; DISTRIBUTION
   RATIO
ID SB; MELTS
AB In view of the application of sodium carbonate slag to the elimination of Sn from molten copper, the thermodynamic properties of NaO0.5-CO2-SnO2 slag have been studied by conducting the following experiments: (1) Activities of NaO0.5 in the slag were determined by the EMF method using beta''-alumina as a solid electrolyte over the composition range of 1 > N greater-than-or-equal-to 0.795 {N = n(Na)/(n(Na) + n(Sn)), n: the number of moles} under the partial pressures of CO2 of 0.00 1 approximately 0.08 MPa at 1423 approximately 1523 K. It was found that the activity of NaO0.5 did not depend on the slag composition for the constant partial pressure of CO2 and the slag was saturated with Na2SnO3(s). (2) Then the solubility of Na2SnO3(S) into sodium carbonate melt was measured under the various partial pressures Of CO2 and oxygen at 1523 K. With decreasing partial pressure of CO2 the solubility increased, but the partial pressure of oxygen had no effect. (3) Activities of SnO2 were determined by the distribution equilibrium measurements for Sn between the Na2SnO3(s)-saturated slag and molten copper. From the activity of SnO2 combined with that of NaO0.5, the standard free energy change for the following reaction was determined as: 2NaO0.5(l) + SnO2(s) = Na2SnO3(S) DELTAG-degrees/kJ = - 159(1523 K) The activity of SnO2 in the homogeneous liquid region of the slag was also evaluated by the distribution equilibrium measurements.
   On the basis of the results obtained, the distribution ratios of Sn between the slag and molten copper were estimated. The ratios decrease with decreasing SnO2 content in the Na2SnO3(s)-saturated slag. The higher oxygen partial pressure and the lower CO2 Partial pressure are more preferable for the removal of Sn from molten copper.
RP FUJISAWA, T (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,SCH ENGN,DEPT MAT SCI & ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.

   TANAMOTO, T
TI SPIN EXCITATIONS IN HIGH-TC CUPRATES
SO JOURNAL OF LOW TEMPERATURE PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE-BOND STATE; MEAN FIELD-THEORY; J MODEL; NEUTRON-SCATTERING;
   HUBBARD-MODEL; SUPERCONDUCTING PROPERTIES; MAGNETIC EXCITATIONS; CUO2
   LAYER; FLUCTUATIONS; RELAXATION
AB The results of theoretical studies on the spin excitations of the extended t - J model treated in the slave-boson mean field theory are briefly summarized and compared with the experimental results of neutron scattering and nuclear magnetic resonance both for LSCO and YBCO. It is found that there exists reasonable overall agreement between experiments and the theory, which predicts the dx2-y2 superconductivity. The remaining unresolved questions are identified and the possible resolutions for some of these are proposed.

TI THEORETICAL-STUDY OF NMR-T1(-1) ON THE BASIS OF THE EXTENDED T-J MODEL
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper

   93)

CL SAN DIEGO, CA

HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
ID MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES
AB The Knight shift, K, and the relaxation rate, T-1(-1), of NMR is calculated in the slave-boson mean-field approximation based on the t-t'-J model. Comparison with the experimental results suggests that singlet formation is related to the drop in (T1T)-1 rather than to that in K.

TI ELECTRONIC STATES OF (DCNQI)2CU
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Strongly Correlated Electron Systems (SCES
   93)
CY AUG 16-19, 1993
CL SAN DIEGO, CA
SP UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO, INST PURE & APPL PHYS SCI, UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO, AMER PHYS SCI, INST MECH & MAT, INT SCI FDN, WASHINGTON, DC, LOS ALAMOS NATL LAB, NATL HIGH MAGNET FIELD LAB, US DOE, US NATL SCI FDN
HO UNIV CALIF SAN DIEGO
AB The characteristic features of the metal-insulator transition of quasi-one-dimensional conductors, (DCNQI)2Cu, have been explained as being due to the unique cooperative onset of the Peierls transition and the Mott transition. It is also proposed that the reentrant metallic state results from the crossover between classical and quantum regimes of the tunneling processes of the rotational motions of radicals.

AF SCHIFFER, P

   OSHEROFF, DD
   FUKUYAMA, H
TI LOW-TEMPERATURE MAGNETIZATION OF HE-3 FILMS
SO JOURNAL OF LOW TEMPERATURE PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID LOW MILLIKELVIN TEMPERATURES; SOLID HE-3; HEAT-CAPACITY; GRAPHITE;
   ORDER; EXCHANGE; GRAFOIL
AB We have made NMR studies of thin films of pure He-3 adsorbed on Grafoil. Such films were cooled to approximately 75 muK, an order of magnitude colder than previous workers could attain. In particular, we measured the magnetization of the solid second atomic layer, (M2), which displays antiferromagnetic (AFM) behavior at low densities and ferromagnetic (FM) behavior at high densities. At both AFM and FM densities, we could measure M2 at temperatures well below the exchange energy (J). Our data at the AFM densities may support a proposed model of that phase. At the FM densities, we have found that M2 (T = 0) is linear in second layer density (rho2) and rises by a factor of approximately 7 with a 6 % increase in rho2 and less than a factor of 2 increase in the apparent value of J, suggesting that the FM phase coexists with a lower density AFM phase. Our high temperature (T > J) data also support such a two phase model. We find that M2 follows the expected behavior for a 2 dimensional Heisenberg ferromagnet down to T much less than J, the first experimental observation of such behavior. We also confirmed the importance of k = 0 spin waves in determining the low temperature behavior of such a system. The NMR lineshape in the FM phase also displayed shifts and broadening due to demagnetization effects which support the model of two phase coexistence.
C1 STANFORD UNIV,DEPT PHYS,STANFORD,CA 94305.
   UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.
RI Schiffer, Peter/F-3227-2011

TI DIRECT DEMAGNETIZATION COOLING OF HIGH-DENSITY SOLID HE-3
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID NUCLEAR ORDERING TEMPERATURE; BCC HE-3; VOLUME DEPENDENCE;
   MULTIPLE-EXCHANGE; MAGNETIC-FIELD; EXCITATIONS
AB Nuclear adiabatic demagnetization has been done for both hcp and bcc solid He-3 with exchange interactions of the order of 10 muK. Observed isochoric pressure increase during the demagnetization for the bcc sample at a molar volume of 19.99 cm3/mol showed clear magnetic transitions at the upper and the lower critical fields as is known for lower density solids. On the other hand, no pressure increase was observed for the hcp sample at 19.07 cm3/mol down to a zero magnetic field. These observations give strong evidence that the ground state in hcp He-3 is ferromagnetic.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RI Akimoto, Hikota/G-7047-2012

TI MACROSCOPIC QUANTUM TUNNELING OF A DOMAIN-WALL IN A FERROMAGNETIC METAL
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB The macroscopic quantum tunneling (MQT) of a planar domain wall in a ferromagnetic metal is studied based on the Hubbard model.  The crucial difference from the case of the insulator is that the ohmic dissipation is present even at zero temperature due to the Stoner excitations characteristic of the electron system.  The disipative effect is very large for a thin domain wall with width lambda comparable to the inverse fermi momentum, but is negligible for a thick domain wall.
RP TATARA, G (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RI Tatara, Gen/I-8676-2012

AF AWAKA, K

TI EFFECTS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ELECTRONS ON THE TUNNELING PROCESSES OF A
   HEAVY-PARTICLE
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
ID FERMI GAS; METALS
AB A new formalism to treat the tunneling processes of a heavy particle coupled to degenerate electron systems has been presented.  This simple and transparent method follows that of Caldeira and Leggett in a general framework, but the term representing the dissipation is given in terms of the retarded density correlation function as far as the coupling is weak.  Hence our method can incorporate the microscopic details of the electronic systems such as mutual interactions and randomness.  It is found that in the Luttinger liquid, the dissipation can be either sub- or super-Ohmic depending on the type of interaction, while near the Anderson transition there exists a crossover from Ohmic to sub-Ohmic dissipation.  It is also found that, in the case of sub-Ohmic dissipation, the tunneling rate vanishes discontinuously above some critical value as a function of the strength of dissipation.
RP AWAKA, K (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RI Tatara, Gen/I-8676-2012
CR AWAKA K, 1993, J APPL PHYS S, V62

TI ISOCHORIC PRESSURE OF HE-3-HE-4 MIXTURE
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB Isochoric pressure measurements of He-3-He-4 mixture were made in order to solve the discrepancy on the He-3 effective mass in the solution.  The obtained He-3 effective mass monotonically increases with He-3 concentration, which is consistent with the calculated result by use of our effective interaction potential.

TI LOW-TEMPERATURE MAGNETIZATION OF PURE HE-3 FILMS ON GRAFOIL
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
ID NUCLEAR
AB Continuous wave NMR was used to study pure He-3 films at coverages from below 2nd layer completion to above the ferromagnetic peak coverage at approximately 2.5 layers.  The films were adsorbed on Grafoil and were cooled to temperatures as low as 0.075 mK.  The measured the ferromagnetic 2nd layer magnetization to temperatures far below the exchange energy (J) as a function of coverage.  Preliminary analysis indicates that J did not vary strongly with coverage, and that the zero temperature 2nd layer magnetization was linear in 2nd layer density.  Both of these properties are consistent with there being two phases in coexistence, only one of which is ferromagnetic.
C1 UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 30031,JAPAN.

TI RADIATION-INDUCED NUCLEATION OF THE AB TRANSITION IN SUPERFLUID HE-3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB The AB transition in superfluid He-3 was studied in regions confined by microscopically smooth surfaces where the transition exhibited dramatic supercooling to lower temperatures than had previously been recorded.  Placing a source of ionizing radiation near the cryostat reduced the lifetime of the metastable A-phase by more than 3 orders of magnitude, supporting Leggett's baked Alaska model.  Additionally, the measured temperature and magnetic field dependences of the lifetime were consistent with the predictions of this model.  Monte Carlo simulations of the interaction of radiation with our sample also support the model and allowed us to estimate the efficiency of radiation in nucleating the transition.
C1 UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 30031,JAPAN.

TI DISSIPATION IN VORTEX STATE OF TYPE-II SUPERCONDUCTORS
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
ID FLUX LIQUIDS; TRANSITION; ORDER
AB The rigidity of the superconductivity of vortex lattice and vortex liquid states in type-II superconductors are investigated by calculating the electric conductivity. We found that, while the vortex liquid is always dissipative, the vortex lattice is superconducting if the electric field is parallel to the magnetic field.

TI MACROSCOPIC QUANTUM TUNNELING OF A DOMAIN-WALL IN A FERROMAGNETIC METAL
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID CHEMICALLY DISORDERED MAGNET; MAGNETIZATION REVERSAL; DISSIPATION;
   PARTICLES
AB The macroscopic quantum tunneling of a planar domain wall in a ferromagnetic metal is studied based on the Hubbard model. It is found that the Ohmic dissipation is present even at zero temperature due to the gapless Stoner excitation, which is the crucial difference from the case of the insulating magnet. The dissipative effect is calculated as a function of the width of the wall and is shown to be effective in a thin wall and in a weak ferromagnet. The results are discussed in the light of recent experiments on ferromagnets with strong anisotropy.
RP TATARA, G (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI NONINVASIVE MEASUREMENT OF REGIONAL CEREBRAL BLOOD-FLOW CHANGE WITH
   (H2O)-O-15 AND POSITRON EMISSION TOMOGRAPHY USING A MECHANICAL INJECTOR
   AND A STANDARD ARTERIAL INPUT FUNCTION
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON MEDICAL IMAGING
LA English
DT Article
ID INTRAVENOUS (H2O)-O-15; ERROR ANALYSIS; CORTEX; PET; WATER
AB To estimate changes in regional cerebral blood flow (rCBF) without arterial sampling in the study of functional-anatomical correlations in the hunan brain, using O-15-labeled water and PET, a standard arterial input function was generated from the Input function in 10 normal volunteers with dose calibration and peak time normalization. The speed and volume of injection were precisely controlled with a mechanical injector. After global normalization of each tissue activity image, the standard arterial input function was applied to obtain estimated CBF images. Relative changes in estimated rCBF to whole brain mean CBF(Delta Fest) and those in regional tissue activity (Delta C) were compared with true relative rCBF changes (Delta F) in 40 pairs of images obtained from 6 normal volunteers. Delta Fest correlated web with Delta F, whereas Delta C consistently underestimated Delta F. This noninvasive method simplifies the activation studies and provides the accurate estimation of relative how changes.
C1 KYOTO UNIV,FAC MED,DEPT BRAIN PATHOPHYSIOL,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI ISOCHORIC PRESSURE AND HE-3 QUASI-PARTICLE EFFECTIVE-MASS IN A HE-3-HE-4
   MIXTURE UNDER PRESSURE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID CURVE; HEAT
AB An accurate isochoric high-pressure measurement was made on a He-3-He-4 liquid mixture at very low temperatures. The obtained data allow us to make a systematic determination of the He-3 effective mass as a function of pressure and He-3 concentration. The dependence is consistent with our proposed He-3 He-3 quasiparticle-interaction potential, but disagrees with the result from the specific-heat measurements.

TI MAGNETIZATION OF HE-3 ON GRAFOIL IN THE LOW-TEMPERATURE LIMIT
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID LOW MILLIKELVIN TEMPERATURES; HEAT-CAPACITY; SOLID HE-3; GRAPHITE; FILMS
AB We have measured the magnetization of the ferromagnetic second layer of pure He-3 films adsorbed on Grafoil down to 0.075 mK. The zero-temperature magnetization is linear in second layer density (rho2) and rises by a factor of approximately 7 with a 6% increase in rho2 and less than a factor of 2 increase in the apparent exchange energy, indicating that the ferromagnetic phase coexists with a lower density phase. This is the first experiment to measure the low-temperature limiting magnetization of a 2D Heisenberg ferromagnet. Our data may also support Elser's model of a registered antiferromagnetic phase at lower rho2.
C1 UNIV TSUKUBA,INST PHYS,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI TUNNELING PROCESSES OF A HEAVY-PARTICLE COUPLED TO METALLIC
   ELECTRON-SYSTEMS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID 2-STATE SYSTEM; FERMI GAS; QUANTUM; DISSIPATION; DYNAMICS;
   SUPERCONDUCTORS; LOCALIZATION; MOTION; MODEL
AB A new formalism to treat the tunneling processes of a heavy particle coupled to degenerate electron systems has been presented. This simple and transparent method follows that of Caldeira and Leggett in a general framework, but the term representing the dissipation is given in terms of the imaginary part of the retarded density correlation function as far as the coupling is weak. Hence our method can incorporate the microscopic details of the electronic systems such as mutual interactions and randomness. It is found that for the Luttinger liquid, the dissipation can be either sub- or super-Ohmic depending on the type of interaction, while near the Anderson transition there exists a crossover from Ohmic to sub-Ohmic dissipation. In the case of sub-Ohmic dissipation, the tunneling rate is found to vanish discontinuously above some critical value as a function of the strength of dissipation.
RP AWAKA, K (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RI Tatara, Gen/I-8676-2012

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF THE EXTENDED T-J MODEL
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE-BOND STATE; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; FLUCTUATIONS; LA2-XSRXCUO4;
   EXCITATIONS
AB Implications of the slave-boson mean-field analysis on the extended t-J model are explored in the context of high-T(c) cuprates. By fitting the Fermi surfaces to those concluded from band calculations, the difference between LSCO and YBCO systems observed in neutron scattering, namely incommensurate versus commensurate spin fluctuations, are reproduced. Moreover, singlet pairing of spinons are shown to lead to the qualitative difference between low- and high-doping materials.
RP KOHNO, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, DEPT PHYS, TOKYO 113, JAPAN.
CR ANDERSON PW, 1987, SCIENCE, V235, P1196, DOI 10.1126/science.235.4793.1196

TI PHASE-SEPARATION AND LONG-RANGE COULOMB INTERACTION IN CUO2 LAYER
   STRUCTURES
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID CHARGE-TRANSFER INSTABILITY; HUBBARD-MODEL; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
AB The possible phase separation due to the charge transfer excitation is investigated for CuO2 layer structures. It is found that the long-range Coulomb interaction does not rule out the phase separation and the bound states of two and three holes exist in the parameter range near the phase separation transition, which is not necessarily near the charge transfer instability.

TI DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPACT NUCLEAR MICROPROBE SYSTEM AND ITS APPLICATION
   TO THE ANALYSIS OF TITANIUM CASTINGS
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON PIXE ( PARTICLE INDUCED X-RAY EMISSION ) AND
   ITS ANALYTICAL APPLICATIONS
CY JUL 20-24, 1992
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP WASEDA UNIV, COMMEMORAT ASSOC JAPAN WORLD EXPOSIT, INOUE FDN SCI, KAJIMA FDN, MURATA SCI FDN, NIPPON SHEET GLASS FDN MAT SCI
HO WASADEA UNIV CONF HALL
ID IMPLANTED ALPHA-TI; DIFFUSION; PROTON
AB A compact nuclear microprobe system with a new configuration and a number of analysis functions has been developed. The overall size of the system is 4.5 (length) x 2.5 (width) x 1.8 (height) m.
   To estimate the focusing performance, secondary electron microscopic (SEM) images of line and 2-dimensional patterns of Au on a Si substrate were obtained. Stripes of 0.75 and 1 mum were resolved in horizontal and vertical directions. respectively.
   Micro-PIXE has been applied to the analysis of Ti castings. Two kinds of casting samples were prepared. They were cast by using a phosphate bonded or an ethylsilicate bonded investment. It was found that Si and P in the former casting diffuse down to at least 160 and 80 mum under the surface and Si in the latter down to at least 40 mum. It was also found that these values of diffusion depths are in good correlation with the results of a micro-Vicker's hardness test.
C1 KOBE STEEL LTD,DIV ENGN & MECH,CHUOH KU,KOBE 651,JAPAN.
   KOBELCO RES INST INC,DEPT DEV,CHUOH KU,KOBE,HYOGO 651,JAPAN.

TI FLUCTUATIONS OF JOSEPHSON CURRENTS AND PERSISTENT CURRENTS IN MESOSCOPIC
   SPIN-GLASS SYSTEMS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID UNIVERSAL CONDUCTANCE FLUCTUATIONS; LANDAU DIAMAGNETISM; METALS; FIELD
AB Effects of correlation of the spin scattering between different measurements in the presence of the spin glass ordering have been investigated for mesoscopic fluctuations of Josephson currents in SNS junctions and those of persistent currents in isolated Aharonov-Bohm (AB) rings. It is found that, because of the absence of the time reversal symmetry, fluctuations of Josephson currents do not vanish even if the phase difference of two superconductors is zero and those of persistent currents in the absence of AB flux is also not zero. Moreover the characteristic length of exponential decay of the fluctuation of Josephson currents can be much longer than that of the average.
RP YOSHIOKA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,7-3-1 HONGO,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF EXTENDED T-J MODEL .1. STATIC PROPERTIES
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID VALENCE-BOND STATE; MEAN FIELD-THEORY; ANGLE-RESOLVED PHOTOEMISSION;
   ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; NUCLEAR-RELAXATION; SPIN SUSCEPTIBILITY;
   FERMI-SURFACE; KNIGHT-SHIFT; CUO2 LAYER; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
AB Spin fluctuations in the extended t-J model have been investigated within the slave-boson mean-field approximation based on both uniform and singlet RVB states. By choosing the transfer integrals to reproduce the Fermi surface of LSCO and YBCO, we find that incommensurate spin fluctuations can be expected for the Fermi surface of LSCO-type, whereas only commensurate ones for that of YBCO-type, in agreement with experiments. Moreover effects of singlet RVB pairing have been explored and are shown to lead to the qualitative difference of the temperature dependences of the shift of nuclear magnetic resonance in the high and low doping regions as seen experimentally.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI ON THE ANOMALOUS MAGNETORESISTANCE IN ALPHA-(BEDT-TTF)2I3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English

ID FIELD-INDUCED SDW; BECHGAARD SALTS; MAGNETIC-FIELD; FERMI-SURFACE;
   PHASE; TRANSITIONS; ELECTRONS
AB It is proposed that the recently observed anomalous magnetoresistance of alpha-(BEDT-TTF)2I3 [Kajita et al., J. Phys. Soc. Jpn. 61 (1992) 23] can be understood by the field-induced spin density wave (FISDW) due to an almost nested quasi-one-dimensional Fermi surface.

TI EFFECTS OF IMPURITIES IN GAAS/ALAS DOUBLE-BARRIER STRUCTURES ON RESONANT
   TRANSMISSION COEFFICIENTS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 1992 INTERNATIONAL CONF ON SOLID STATE DEVICES AND MATERIALS ( SSDM 92 )
CY AUG 26-28, 1992
CL TSUKUBA, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS
DE DOUBLE-BARRIER STRUCTURE; RESONANT TUNNELING DIODE; TRANSMISSION
   COEFFICIENT; CHARGE ACCUMULATION; IMPURITY; GAAS/ALAS
ID TUNNELING DIODES
AB The resonant transmission coefficients for GaAs/AlAs double-barrier structures are estimated from the d2I/dV2-V characteristics of resonant tunneling diodes and the effects of impurities doped in these structures are investigated. The estimation method was proven to be reliable by comparing the I-V curve reproduced from the experimentally estimated coefficients with the measured curve. Double peaks were found in the transmission coefficient for samples doped with Si in the well. The two peaks observed are probably attributable to tunneling through the quasi-bound state created by impurities and to tunneling through the resonant state.
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,LSI LABS,3-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI,KANAGAWA 24301,JAPAN.

AU FUKUYAMA, H
AF FUKUYAMA, H
TI ELECTRONIC STATES OF (DCNQI)2CU
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article
ID ONE-DIMENSIONAL CONDUCTORS; RADICAL-ANION SALTS;
   N,N'-DICYANOQUINONEDIIMINE DCNQI; ELECTRICAL-CONDUCTIVITY;
   STRUCTURAL-PROPERTIES; MOLECULAR CONDUCTORS; MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES;
   PHASE-TRANSITIONS; (DME-DCNQI)2CU; SYSTEM
AB The phase diagram of quasi-one-dimensional conductors, (DCNQI)2Cu, in the plane of pressure and temperature has interesting features: It has the metal-insulator transition which is of the first order arid the insulating state has the three-fold lattice distortion together with the strong magnetism apparently resulting from localized moments. These are explained as due to the Peierls transition in the presence of strong correlations in Cu sites. It is proposed that the reentrant metallic state results from the crossover between classical and quantum regimes of the tunneling processes of the rotational motions of either CH3 or CH3O radicals.
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI LOW-TEMPERATURE STUDIES OF THE NMR FREQUENCY-SHIFT IN SUPERFLUID HE-3-A
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID MAGNETIC-FIELD; TRANSITION; LIQUID; PHASES
AB We report the first measurements of the longitudinal resonance frequency [nu(long)(A)] in He-3-A in the low-temperature limit, as well as new measurements near T(c). In the low-temperature limit, our data agree well with theoretically predicted behavior. The data allow us to make the first estimates of the BCS cutoff energy as a function of pressure and of the zero-temperature A-phase energy gap.

AU SUZUMURA, Y
   FUKUYAMA, H
AF SUZUMURA, Y
   FUKUYAMA, H
TI MEAN-FIELD THEORY OF MIXED-VALENCE CONDUCTORS (R1, R2-DCNQI)2 CU
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID TEMPERATURE PHASE-DIAGRAM; PERIODIC ANDERSON MODEL; ELECTRON METAL
   SYSTEM; ANION-RADICAL SALTS; MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES; STRUCTURAL-PROPERTIES;
   MOLECULAR CONDUCTORS; (2,5 DM-DCNQI)2CU; = CH3; CONDUCTIVITY
AB The insulating state of (R1, R2-DCNQI)2Cu salts showing both the mixed valence of Cu+ and Cu++ and the three-fold lattice distortion has been examined by the mean-field theory to the periodic Anderson model where two one-dimensional conduction bands with the electron-phonon interaction are coupled to Cu ions. For the choice of the interaction constant which leads to approximately Cu+4/3 as an average, it is shown that modulations of both charge density and spin density coexist in the ground state and that the phase transition at finite temperature is of the first order.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI STRONG SUPERCOOLING AND STIMULATION OF THE A-B TRANSITION IN SUPERFLUID
   HE-3
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID NUCLEATION; PHASE
AB We report the first studies of the A-B transition in superfluid He-3 confined by microscopically smooth surfaces. The transition exhibited dramatic supercooling, down to 0.15T(c). The lifetime-tau of the metastable A phase has a temperature dependence consistent with Leggett's "baked Alaska" model based on nucleation by ionizing radiation. Radiation sources near the cryostat strongly reduce the lifetime, but do not alter its temperature dependence, and tau increases with increasing magnetic field in accord with Leggett's model.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI EFFECTS OF IMPURITY SCATTERING ON RESONANT TRANSMISSION COEFFICIENTS IN
   GAAS/ALAS DOUBLE-BARRIER STRUCTURES
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE DOUBLE-BARRIER STRUCTURE; RESONANT TUNNELING DIODE; TRANSMISSION
   COEFFICIENT; IMPURITY SCATTERING; LEVEL BROADENING; GAAS/AIAS
ID TUNNELING DIODES
AB We investigate the effects of impurity scattering on resonant transmission coefficients in GaAs /AlAs double-barrier structures. The coefficients are estimated from d2I/dV2- V characteristics of resonant tunneling diodes, using a recently introduced method. To our knowledge, this is the first time that resonance level broadening due to ionized impurity scattering has been shown experimentally.

TI ORBITAL MAGNETISM OF 2-DIMENSIONAL ELECTRONS IN CONFINING POTENTIALS
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE ORBITAL MAGNETISM; LANDAU DIAMAGNETISM; MESOSCOPIC SYSTEM; QUANTUM DOTS
ID LANDAU DIAMAGNETISM; MESOSCOPIC SYSTEMS; FLUCTUATIONS; METALS; FIELD
AB Magnetizations of finite two-dimensional systems in external potentials are investigated. Magnetic field and temperature dependence of the magnetization is calculated exactly. It is found that the magnetization is well defined in the limit of vanishing magnetic field as well as in the limit of T = 0, and that it shows large fluctuation at low temperature as the magnetic field is varied. It is shown that this fluctuating magnetization tends to the Landau diamagnetism at higher temperature or by ensemble averaging.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 153,JAPAN.

TI SOLUBILITIES OF CO2 AND REDOX EQUILIBRIA OF SB AND AS IN NAO0.5-SBOM AND
   NAO0.5-ASOM MELTS
SO MATERIALS TRANSACTIONS JIM
LA English
DT Article
DE CO2 SOLUBILITY; REDOX EQUILIBRIUM; NAO0.5-SBOMMELT; NAO0.5-ASOMMELT;
   SB3+/SB5+; AS3+/AS5+; SBO43-; ASO43-; SBO2-
AB Solubilities of CO2 and redox ratios of Sb and As (n(Sb3+)/n(Sb5+), n(As3+)/n(As5+), n: the number of moles) in NaO0.5-SbOm and NaO0.5-AsOm melts were studied. The equilibrium measurements were conducted over the composition range of 1 > N > 0.7 {= n(NaO0.5)/(n(NaO0.5) + n(MO(m)), M:Sb or As} under the partial pressures of CO2 and O2 of 0.01 approximately 0.1 MPa and 0.005 approximately 1000 Pa, respectively, at the temperatures of 1423 and 1523 K.
   Antimony exists in NaO0.5-CO2-SbOm melts not only in pentavalent (SbO43-) but also in trivalent (SbO2-) state, their relative proportions depending on the experimental conditions. The CO2 solubility in the melts is, therefore, determined by the following reactions: 3CO32- + 2SbO2.5 = 2SbO43- + 3CO2 CO32- = CO2 + O2-and SbO2- + O2- + 1/2O2 = SbO43-.
   Arsenic exists predominantly in the form of pentavalent anion (AsO43-) in NaO0.5-CO2-AsOm), melts. As the pentavalent arsenic is more stable compared with antimony, the redox reaction of arsenic has almost no effect on the CO, solubility in the melts. Thus CO2 solubility is determined only by the following two reactions: 3CO32- + 2AsO2.5 = 2AsO43- + 3CO2 and CO32- = CO2 + O2-, However, with increasing content of arsenic oxide in the melts, the evaporation reaction of trivalent arsenic oxide (AS4O6), AsO43- = 1/4As4O6(g) + 1/2O2 + 3/2O2-, becomes significant.
RP FUJISAWA, T (reprint author), NAGOYA UNIV,SCH ENGN,DEPT MAT SCI & ENGN,NAGOYA 46401,JAPAN.
CR FUJISAWA T, 1989, J JPN I MET, V53, P558

TI PHASE-SEPARATION CURVE OF HE-3-HE-4 MIXTURES UNDER PRESSURE
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID LIQUID HE-4; HEAT; TEMPERATURE; SOLUBILITY; DENSITY
AB The solubility of He-3 in He-4 has been measured under pressure up to 20 bars in the temperature range between 1 and 250 mK. At temperatures below 60 mK, the solubility varies as T2 at all pressures. The coefficient of the T2 term at 0 bar, beta, is 8.29+/-0.03 K-2, lower than the values of 9-11 K-2 reported previously. The value of beta rapidly decreases down to 3.92+/-0.03 K-2 at 15 bars with increasing pressure. The interaction potential between He-3 quasiparticles is obtained by analyzing the solubility data on the basis of Ebner's formula. The effective mass derived from the potential has a weak and positive dependence on the He-3 concentration at all pressures.
RP YOROZU, S (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,7-22-1 ROPPONGI,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RI Akimoto, Hikota/G-7047-2012

TI THE GOLDSTONE MODES OF THE ABRIKOSOV VORTEX LINE LATTICE
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID II SUPERCONDUCTORS; TYPE-2 SUPERCONDUCTORS; ORDER PARAMETER; ELASTIC
   ENERGY; MAGNETIC-FIELD; FLUX LINES; INDUCTIONS; STATE
AB A new theoretical framework to treat the thermal fluctuations of the Abrikosov vortex line lattice is presented.  The effective free energy to describe the low energy fluctuations is derived which concludes the same elastic modes as those derived by Brandt on one hand and the phase fluctuation mode around the vortices on the other hand.  The existence of the superconducting long range order in the Abrikosov vortex line lattice is discussed from a new view point by examining the asymptotic behavior of the gauge invariant correlation function.
RP HAYASHI, M (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,7-22-1 ROPPONGI,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI 2-DIMENSIONAL HUBBARD-MODEL IN LOW ELECTRON-DENSITY LIMIT
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID SCATTERING; STATE
AB The two dimensional Hubbard model with repulsive interaction is studied in the t-matrix approximation.  At T = 0 the particle-particle correlation function and the t-matrix are obtained analytically so that it is shown that the t-matrix and hence the self-energy have no singularities in the upper half plane of the complex energy variable.  The phase angle of the t-matrix, delta(2k(F) + q,omega), in the limit q --> 0 and omega --> 0, is found to depend on the ratio omega/q and is not always zero.  This non-vanishing phase angle results in the logarithmic correction to the imaginary part of the self-energy as Im-SIGMA(k(F),epsilon) infinity epsilon-2 ln parallel-to epsilon parallel-to.  However, the renormalization factor Z is finite at the Fermi surface suggesting that the stability of the Fermi liquid state at least within the conventional perturbation theory.  The case of the attractive interaction has also been studied and the crossover from the Copper pairing to the real-space pairing is indicated.
C1 HIMEJI INST TECHNOL,FAC SCI,DEPT MAT SCI,KAMIGORI,HYOGO 67812,JAPAN.
RP NARIKIYO, O (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,ROPPONGI,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES IN T-J MODEL
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID NORMAL-STATE; SPIN; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; RELAXATION; YBA2CU3O7; OXIDES
AB The dynamical spin susceptibility, chi(q  -->, omega), of the t - J model on a square lattice has been studied based on a mean field (MF) approximation within the slave-boson (SB) formalism.  We found that T1T has a minimum at T = (0.1 approximately 0.2)J and that Imchi(q  -->, omega) at q  --> = Q  --> = (pi, pi) has a gap like structure as a function of omega if the temperature is low.  These theoretical results indicating an apparent spin gap are consistent with experimental observations.

TI THE HC/E VS HC/2E OSCILLATIONS IN THE SNS JUNCTION
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID PROXIMITY
AB The Josephson current induced by the proximity effect is studied for the SNS junction with the mesoscopic Aharonov-Bohm ring in the normal region.  The results shows that the critical current has a component with hc/e oscillation in addition to hc/2e oscillation, the former of which is particular to the mesoscopic system.  The relative intensity of these two oscillation will be discussed for various cases.

TI CHARGE-TRANSFER INSTABILITY AND SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID CUO2 LAYER
AB Superconductivity in the system near charge transfer instability is investigated for CuO2 layer structure.  By treating the transfer between Cu and O perturbatively, the effective interaction of O holes is derived and the possible symmetries of superconductivity is studied.  The critical temperatures of superconductivity are estimated as a function of the doping rate, delta, based on weak-coupling approximation and are found to have characteristic delta-dependences depending on symmetry.  We also examined the possible ground states with n = 1, 2, 3 or 4 holes for a wide range of the Coulomb repulsions on Cu sites and O sites.

TI CLUSTER MODEL CALCULATION OF THE ELECTRONIC STATES OF THE D-P MODEL AND
   ITS EFFECTIVE HAMILTONIAN
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY HIGH
   TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS 3
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
ID TC CU-OXIDES; LAYER
AB Electronic states of the d-p model and its effective Hamiltonian are investigated numerically on a small cluster.  The latter has been derived by the assumption that Cu++ is stable against doping.  It turns out that for standard set of parameters the effective Hamiltonian reproduces semi-quantitatively various physical properties, such as spin correlation and energy spectrum, of the original d-p model.  In the effective Hamiltonian an appreciable attractive force appears between two O-holes around the same Cu site near the charge-transfer instability, whose validity is critically studied.

TI INTERACTION BETWEEN A VORTEX AND AN INCLUSION IN SUPERCONDUCTORS

AB Interaction between vortex and inhomogeneity in superconductors is studied.  As a typical example, we investigated the case of a single vortex near an inclusion of the cylindrical shape and derived the interaction potential for the vortex as a function of the distance by use of the solution of London equation.

TI VOLUME DEPENDENCE OF THE LOWER CRITICAL-FIELD IN NUCLEAR-SPIN ORDERED
   BCC HE-3
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID SOLID HE-3; EXCHANGE; MAGNETISM; PRESSURE; TEMPERATURE; HEAT
AB The zero-temperature lower critical field B(c1) (0) between the two nuclear antiferromagnetic phases of bcc He-3 has been determined as a function of molar volume from pressure measurements down to 120-mu-K.  In a volume range between 22.45 and 24.06 cm3/mol, the Gruneisen parameter for B(c1) (0) is anomalously small compared to typical values for other physical quantities associated with the exchange interactions.  The result suggests that the two-spin exchange frequency decreases more rapidly with decreasing volume than three- and four-spin exchanges in the terms of the multiple-spin exchange model.
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF T-J MODEL
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID DENSITY-FUNCTIONAL THEORY; STRONG-COUPLING MODELS; SPIN-RELAXATION
   RATES; VALENCE-BOND STATE; LARGE-N LIMIT; CU-O; TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENCE;
   ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE; NUCLEAR-RELAXATION; HUBBARD-MODEL
AB The dynamical spin susceptibility chi (q, omega), of the t-J model in two-dimensional square lattice have been studied based on the mean field approximation to the slave-boson formalism. The static spin susceptibility, chi (q, 0), and Im chi (q, omega) at various energy, omega, have been calculated. We found; 1) chi (0,0) has only weak temperature dependence 2) T1T is-proportional-to (T + theta) for T greater-than-or-similar-to 0.1 J with theta-linearly dependent on the doping rate, delta-3) T1T has a minimum at T = (0.1 approximately 0.2)J 4) Im chi (q, omega) at q = Q = (pi, pi) has a gap like structure as a function of omega if the temperature is low. All these are consistent with experimental results.
C1 KOBE UNIV, DEPT PHYS, NADA KU, KOBE 657, JAPAN.
RP TANAMOTO, T (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, INST SOLID STATE PHYS, 7-22-1 ROPPONGI, MINATO KU, TOKYO 106, JAPAN.

TI 2-DIMENSIONAL HUBBARD-MODEL AT LOW ELECTRON-DENSITY
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID FERMI-LIQUID THEORY; BOSE CONDENSATION; 2 DIMENSIONS; STATE;
   SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; GAS; SCATTERING; PAIRS
AB The two dimensional Hubbard model with repulsive interaction is studied in the t-matrix approximation, which is the valid approximation in low electron density. The particle-particle correlation function and the t-matrix are obtained analytically. By use of these analytical results it is shown that the t-matrix and hence the self-energy have no singularities in the upper half plane of the complex energy variable. The phase angle delta(2k(F) + q, omega), with k(F) being the Fermi wave vector, in the limit of q = 0 and omega = 0 is found to depend strongly on the ratio omega/q and is not always zero. The case of the attractive interaction is also briefly studied.
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO, INST SOLID STATE PHYS, 7-22-1 ROPPONGI, MINATO KU, TOKYO 106, JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY NEAR CHARGE-TRANSFER INSTABILITY IN CUO2 STRUCTURE
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
ID EXTENDED HUBBARD-MODEL; OXIDES; LA2CUO4; STATE; LAYER
AB The possible symmetries of superconductivity is studied on a system near charge transfer instability in CuO2 layer structure for a case where the Cu sites do not have magnetic moment.  This case corresponds either to ignore the existence of magnetic moments in actual high T(c) Cu-oxides by focusing only on charge fluctuations or to consider the ground state configurations of d8 or d10 at the Cu-sites.  By deriving effective interaction processes, which become important near the charge transfer instability, the critical temperatures have been estimated as a function of the doping rate, delta, based on weak-coupling approximation.  It is seen that they have characteristic delta-dependence depending on symmetry.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI COMPACT NUCLEAR MICROPROBE SYSTEM FOR RBS/PIXE
SO NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM
   INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS
LA English
DT Article
ID MEV HELIUM ION; MICROBEAM ANALYSIS; GALLIUM-ARSENIDE; PROTON; LINE;
   MICROANALYSIS; LOCATION; PROBE; OSAKA; BEAMS
AB A compact nuclear microprobe system for RBS/PIXE with an overall size of 4.5 m (length) x 2.5 m (width) x 1.8 m (height), including an accelerator, has been created by arranging an accelerator, objective slits, an E x B filter and a quadrupole magnet doublet in order in a straight line.  The beamline was designed to produce a collimated beam with a divergence of less than 0.01-degrees for channeling measurements, as well as a microprobe with a spot size of about 1-mu-m for micro-RBS/PIXE measurements, by only adjusting the lens currents.  A measuring chamber has a goniometer of our own original design with four axes and a revolving disk head holding 30 samples for automatic sequential measurements.  The combination of two kinds of beam and two sample manipulators make the system extremely versatile.
   This paper describes fully the system design and details of the main components.  The optical aberration caused by an E x B filter is discussed using computer simulation, and measured ion contamination due to the arrangement of the system in a straight line is evaluated.
C1 KOBE STEEL LTD,DIV ENGN & MACHINERY,CHUOH KU,KOBE 651,JAPAN.
RP INOUE, K (reprint author), KOBE STEEL LTD,ELECTR RES LAB,NISHI KU,KOBE,HYOGO 65122,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-DIAGRAM OF BCC HE-3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 19TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON LOW TEMPERATURE PHYSICS ( LT-19 )
CY AUG 16-22, 1990
CL BRIGHTON, ENGLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS, ELSEVIER NORTH HOLLAND PUBL, UNIV SUSSEX, INST PHYS, USAF, GEC
ID ORDERED SOLID HE-3; NUCLEAR MAGNETISM; EXCHANGE; PRESSURE; TEMPERATURE;
   TRANSITIONS; FIELDS
AB A complete magnetic phase diagram of bcc solid He-3 at a molar volume of 22.7 cm3/mol has been determined by pressure measurements at temperatures down to 250-mu-K in magnetic fields up to 7 T.  The transition temperature between the paramagnetic phase and the high-field antiferromagnetic ordered phase increases with field and reaches a maximum (= 0.96 mK) at 3 T.  Above this field, it turns to decrease and seems to be zero at 5.4 T, i.e., the upper critical field B(c2)(0).  The transition is not the first-order one from 1 T to B(c2)(0).  The observed reentrant phase diagram strongly supports the multiple spin exchange model, but reveals a severe quantitative inaccuracy of the mean field approximation even at high fields near B(c2)(0).
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
RI Akimoto, Hikota/G-7047-2012
CR ADAMS ED, 1980, PHYS REV LETT, V44, P789, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevLett.44.789

TI CHIRAL SPIN STATE AND ANYONS IN EXTENDED T-J MODEL
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
ID RESONATING-VALENCE-BOND; LARGE-N LIMIT; FRACTIONAL-STATISTICS; CU
   OXIDES; SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; FLUX
AB The extended t - J model has been studied within a mean field approximation by use of the slave boson scheme. It is found that there exists some range of parameters where the chiral spin state is stabilized. The Chern-Simons Lagrangian for the gauge field, which represents the fluctuation of the phases of the order parameters and the local constraint, is obtained by integrating out spin fermion fields as in the undoped case studied by Wen, Wilczek and Zee. The coefficient of this term turns out to depend on doping. Due to the coupling to this Chern-Simons gauge field, hole bosons are transmuted into anyons.

AU FUKUYAMA, H
   HASEGAWA, Y
AF FUKUYAMA, H
   HASEGAWA, Y
TI T-MATRIX APPROXIMATION TO 2-DIMENSIONAL HUBBARD-MODEL
SO PROGRESS OF THEORETICAL PHYSICS SUPPLEMENT
LA English
DT Article
AB The low-density regime of the two-dimensional Hubbard model has been investigated by the t-matrix approximation, i.e., by taking into account the particle-particle ladder processes represented in terms of particle-particle correlation function, K(q, x + i-delta).  The q-dependence of K(q, x + i-delta) in the region of small x has been examined in detail and it is found that the imaginary part of self-energy function of electrons depends on excitation energy, epsilon, as epsilon-2ln\epsilon\ which are due to contributions involving K(q, x + i-delta) with q congruent-to 2k(F), k(F) being the fermi momentum.  The existence of the upper Hubbard band for the case of large U has also been demonstrated.
RP FUKUYAMA, H (reprint author), UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
CR Abrikosov A. A., 1963, METHODS QUANTUM FIEL
   ANDERSON PW, 1987, SCIENCE, V235, P1196, DOI 10.1126/science.235.4793.1196
   ANDERSON PW, 1990, PHYS REV LETT, V64, P1839, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevLett.64.1839
   ANDERSON PW, SINGULAR FORWARD SCA
   ANDERSON PW, 1987, P E FERMI INT SCH PH
   BLOOM P, 1975, PHYS REV B, V12, P125, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevB.12.125
   Brinkman WF, 1970, PHYS REV B-SOLID ST, V2, P4302, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevB.2.4302
   FUJIMOTO S, 1990, J PHYS SOC JPN, V59, P2316, DOI 10.1143/JPSJ.59.2316
   GUTZWILLER MC, 1963, PHYS REV LETT, V10, P159, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevLett.10.159
   GUTZWILL.MC, 1965, PHYS REV, V137, P1726
   HODGES C, 1971, PHYS REV B-SOLID ST, V4, P302, DOI 10.1103/PhysRevB.4.302
